KnowledgeBase.Title: isVector
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes:
Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector
FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory
Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex Boolean
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions:
isType isBitVector isFloatVector
isIntegerVector isByteVector isIdentical
isNumberVector isPcodeVector isObjectVector
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: Vector bit byte bitvector Boolean object subtype

Function.Description: The isVector function returns true if the argument is a Vector or any Vector subtype such as Bit Vector, Number Vector, Float Vector, etc. , ; otherwise, false is returned.

Brief.Overview: The isVector function returns true if the argument {obj} is a Vector or any Vector subtype such as Bit Vector, Number Vector, Float Vector, etc. , otherwise, the function returns false.
Brief.Usage: The isVector function is a Boolean function that determines if an object is of type Vector.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector,
FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory,
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex, Boolean

Syntax.Return: Returns true if the object is a Vector, otherwise false is returned.
